title: Starting Salary vs College GPA
question_text:
Sixty-five random recent college graduates were selected and asked their college grade point average (GPA) as well as their starting salary on their first job. This resulted in a a regression equation of $\hat{y}=9.7x + 23.6$ where $x$ is GPA and $\hat{y}$ is the predicted salary (in thousands of dollars). The standard error was $0.25$.
Find a $99\%$ confidence interval for the slope and interpret it.

choices.text:
(
9.035
,
10.365
) We are
99
%
confident that the interval from
9.035
to
10.365
contains the slope of the true regression line relating grade point average and starting salary. We have convincing evidence that there is an association between theses two variables.
